key_points: Brayden Harrington, a 13-year-old who shares a bond with President Joe Biden over stuttering, delivered a rendition of JFK's inaugural address during the inauguration celebration.
The event, 'Celebrating America', was a 90-minute program hosted by Tom Hanks, featuring performances, poetry, and former presidents.
Harrington highlighted the importance of Biden's inauguration for children who stutter, showing them that they matter.
Biden and Harrington met in February during a campaign stop in Concord, where Biden shared strategies to overcome stuttering.
Biden encouraged Brayden not to let his stutter define him and assured him of his intelligence.
Biden has publicly shared his own experiences with stuttering and being teased as a child.
Brayden spoke at the Democratic National Convention in August, crediting Biden for his newfound confidence.
The speech Brayden gave at the DNC, where he praised Biden, has been viewed millions of times.
Brayden Harrington has signed a book deal and will be releasing a children's book titled 'Brayden Speaks Up' on August 10, with a middle-grade novel to follow in 2022.
'Brayden Speaks Up' aims to share his story and inspire others dealing with stuttering.
